### Experiment ID

highresSST-present

### Experiment Title

AMIP historic

### Description

1. Experiment Configuration
Conduct an atmosphere-only simulation similar to CMIP AMIP for the period 1980–2022 using high-resolution daily forcing

2. Model Settings
Initial Conditions: Use ERA5 for atmosphere and land initial conditions on 1 January 1980.
Spinup: Treat 1980–1981 as land surface spinup. Analyze 1982–2022.
Forcing Interpolation: Interpolate daily mean fields (no diurnal cycle) to the model grid.

3. Forcing Data
Use 0.05° ESA CCI SST v3.0 and OSI SAF sea ice concentration instead of the 1/4° HadISST.2.2.0 dataset.

4. Key Differences from CMIP6 HighResMIP
SST Forcing: Upgraded to 0.05° ESA CCI SST.
Land Spinup: 2 years recommended; alternative methods allowed if documented.

For details, see:
Roberts et al. (2025). High-Resolution Model Intercomparison Project phase 2 (HighResMIP2) towards CMIP7. Geoscientific Model Development, 18, 1307–1332

### Experiment ID

dcppB-forecast-cmip6

### Experiment Title

forecast initialized from observations with forcing from ssp245

### Description

CMIP6 DCPP (Boer et al., 2016; www.geosci-model-dev.net/9/3751/2016/) experiments B1 (and B2.1, B2.2)--ongoing fully-coupled decadal forecasts initialized from observation-based states. First full forecast year follows start year (e.g., for 2025 initialization, first full forecast year is 2026). This AR7 FastTrack experiment is a real-time extension of CMIP6 DCPP component B, so a pre-requisite is completion of CMIP6 DCPP component A (experiment id: dcppA-hindcast). For participation in AR7, forecasts should be 10 years long with minimum of 10 ensemble members.

### Experiment ID

esm-flat10-cdr

### Experiment Title

10 PgC/yr constant CO2 removal / negative emissions experiment

### Description

esm-flat10-cdr is newly introduced for CMIP7 as an emissions-driven idealised experiment to quantify sensitivity of the earth system to CO2 removal / negative emissions.

It requires fully-coupled AOGCM and BGC models with carbon cycle “emissions-driven”

The esm-flat10-cdr experiment branches from year 100 of the esm-flat10 simulation, but with CO2 emissions set to decline linearly to zero after 50 years, decrease further (becoming negative) over the next 50 years (reaching -10 PgC/yr) and then remain constant at -10 PgC/yr for a final 100 years.

It serves as an emissions-driven experiment to diagnose the reversibility of the Earth system due to carbon dioxide removal. By the end of the simulation the cumulative emissions over 300 years will be exactly zero – the same amount of CO2 has been removed as was added.

Used with the partner experiments esm-flat10 and esm-flat10-zec it forms a vital part of assessment of TCRE, ZEC and reversibility. In particular these experiments make assessment of ZEC easier than CMIP6 because: the experiment is emissions-driven from the outset and does not require a change in configuration at the branch point and the branch point is common across all models. 

more details and analysis can be found here:
https://egusphere.copernicus.org/preprints/2023/egusphere-2023-2127/
https://egusphere.copernicus.org/preprints/2024/egusphere-2024-3356/ 

this experiment is an evolution of the CDRMIP simulations from CMIP6: https://gmd.copernicus.org/articles/11/1133/2018/

### Experiment ID

1pctCO2-rad

### Experiment Title

radiatively-coupled version of 1 percent per year increasing CO2 experiment

### Description

1pctCO2-rad is retained from CMIP6.

It is a simulation which branches from piControl with a 1% per year increase in CO2 concentration from pre-industrial levels, with the CO2 “radiatively-coupled”. This means that only the model’s radiation code responds to the increase in CO2, whereas the model’s carbon cycle components (both land and ocean) use a constant, preindustrial concentration of CO2.

The 1pctCO2 DECK simulation is required for comparison. This experiment is designed to isolate carbon-concentration and carbon climate elements of the global carbon feedbacks. It will also enable calibration of climate emulators. 

See Jones et al 2016: https://gmd.copernicus.org/articles/9/2853/2016/ , especially section 3.2.3
Example of use/analysis is Arora et al. 2020: https://bg.copernicus.org/articles/17/4173/2020/

body:
After reviewing the form gathering information for experiment registration, I think the following revisions are needed:

1.	In “add a title” 
Replace “Add/Modify: Experiment: ``<Type experiment name here>``"
With “Add/Modify: Experiment: ``<Type experiment ID here>``”
Reason: we might as well use the experiment ids as unique identifiers.  I don’t think the MIPs will know what to put for a “name”.
2.	At the very beginning (just after “add a title”), provide some initial guidance:  “Before filling out his form, you should review experiment information [here](https://wcrp-cmip.github.io/CMIP6_CVs/docs/CMIP6_experiment_id.html) provided by the MIPs for CMIP6, which is similar to what is requested below.”  
3.	Further guidance is needed before the MIPs will be able to provide what we need under “Description”.  As a MIP leader, I would have trouble knowing how exactly to respond to the request for experiment design details.   If this information is needed, can we replace all the guidance currently provided with: 
“Please provide a brief description of the experiment along the lines of the descriptions recorded in the last column of [this table](https://wcrp-cmip.github.io/CMIP6_CVs/docs/CMIP6_experiment_id.html).  Point out anything that differentiates this experiment from similar CMIP7 experiments and note if it is similar to a particular CMIP6 experiment.   If available, include links to documents describing in more detail the experiment design.”
4.	Under MIP / Activity, replace “Please select a parent from the list below.” with “Please select MIP from the list below”.
5.	The section regarding “parent experiment” will be needlessly confusing to most MIPs.  The table of scenarioMIP experiments should be eliminated or those experiments should be treated just like the other fasttrack experiments and be included in the drop-down list.  Also, the last 2 entries in the current drop-down list should be eliminated (i.e. delete “very low scenario low overshoot” and “very low scenario high overshoot”).  Only experiment ids should be listed.
title: Revisions to the registration form for experiments

body:
The current version of the experiment CV will need to be reviewed and possibly modified by the CV Task Team before serving in an official capacity.  In particular, the following changes will be contemplated:

1.  Add "host_collection" (hostCollectionDD) to each experiment.  (This is needed for ESGF searches and archive management; it will be included in the DRS.)
2. Remove "sub_experiment_id" from each entry.  I think this is not needed in CMIP7 since the start date or "decadal prediction" experiments will be recorded in the "ripf" variant_id (e.g., "r1i2010p1f1")
3. Add an "experiment title" to each experiment.   These should be terse descriptions of the experiments useful in jogging the memory regarding what the experiment_id stands for.  In CMIP6 this was recorded as the "experiment" global attribute as given in column 3 of https://wcrp-cmip.github.io/CMIP6_CVs/docs/CMIP6_experiment_id.html.
4. Replace "parent_activity" with "parent_collection".  This will identify both the activity and the phase that produced the parent experiment.
5. Consider using the generic data descriptor names as keys in all CVs, so that it is easier to access CVs in a uniform way across projects and MIP phases.
6. If not already included, include a list of "additional_allowed_model_components" for each experiment.
